content:
DbCommandTree Class

Definition

An immutable class that implements the basic functionality for the Query, Insert, Update, Delete, and function invocation command tree types.

In this Article

public abstract class DbCommandTree
Inheritance
System.Object
DbCommandTree

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

A DbCommandTree is an abstract class that is used to represent queries, Data Manipulation Language (DML) operations and function/procedure invocations.

Properties

Parameters

Gets the name and corresponding type of each parameter that can be referenced within this DbCommandTree.

public System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair<string,System.Data.Metadata.Edm.TypeUsage>> Parameters { get; }
Value
IEnumerable<KeyValuePair<String,TypeUsage>>

The name and corresponding type of each parameter that can be referenced within this DbCommandTree.
